DataElement.preferredName: Initial Adverse Event Reporter Geographic Area Email Address
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree._Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._Somebody who makes a report of any kind, e.g. a person who is authorized to gather and give a formal or official account or description of findings, events, issues and other information regarding clinical study, drug adverse effect, preclinical research results, data and safety monitoring, etc. to appropriate agency or institution._All of the continents and every country situated within, the UNITED STATES and each of the constituent states arranged by region, CANADA and each of its provinces, AUSTRALIA and each of its states, the major bodies of water and major islands on both hemispheres, and selected major cities. Although the geographic locations are not printed in INDEX MEDICUS as main headings, in indexing they are significant in epidemiologic studies and historical articles and for locating administrative units in education and the delivery of health care._The string of characters that represents an electronic mail address. [Explanatory comment:  The format for this value domain is the SMTP standard local-part@domain]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Initial Adverse Event Reporter Geographic Area
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree._Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._Somebody who makes a report of any kind, e.g. a person who is authorized to gather and give a formal or official account or description of findings, events, issues and other information regarding clinical study, drug adverse effect, preclinical research results, data and safety monitoring, etc. to appropriate agency or institution._All of the continents and every country situated within, the UNITED STATES and each of the constituent states arranged by region, CANADA and each of its provinces, AUSTRALIA and each of its states, the major bodies of water and major islands on both hemispheres, and selected major cities. Although the geographic locations are not printed in INDEX MEDICUS as main headings, in indexing they are significant in epidemiologic studies and historical articles and for locating administrative units in education and the delivery of health care.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:Any unfavorable or unintended symptom, sign, or disease including an abnormal laboratory finding) temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure.  Such events can be intervention related, dose related, route related, patient related, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).:Somebody who makes a report of any kind, e.g. a person who is authorized to gather and give a formal or official account or description of findings, events, issues and other information regarding clinical study, drug adverse effect, preclinical research results, data and safety monitoring, etc. to appropriate agency or institution.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

Somebody who makes a report of any kind, e.g. a person who is authorized to gather and give a formal or official account or description of findings, events, issues and other information regarding clinical study, drug adverse effect, preclinical research results, data and safety monitoring, etc. to appropriate agency or institution.

Property.preferredDefinition: All of the continents and every country situated within, the UNITED STATES and each of the constituent states arranged by region, CANADA and each of its provinces, AUSTRALIA and each of its states, the major bodies of water and major islands on both hemispheres, and selected major cities. Although the geographic locations are not printed in INDEX MEDICUS as main headings, in indexing they are significant in epidemiologic studies and historical articles and for locating administrative units in education and the delivery of health care.

Concepts.definition: Any demarcated area of the Earth; may be determined by both natural and human boundaries.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: all components of an address, including building number, street name and type, city, state, postal code, and country.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The string of characters that represents an electronic mail address. [Explanatory comment:  The format for this value domain is the SMTP standard local-part@domain]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: contact information for communications over distance, including telephone and fax numbers, e-mail, and web addresses.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/22/22 jk added "Qualified" RS as part of MCL quarterly content review.

DataElement.changeDescription: Released as part of the Draft New Cleanup_11.07.18; Curated to support FDA MedWatch Form 3500 and 3500A
